metadata.name: Publisher Attachment File Dropped In Suspicious Location
metadata.comment: Detects creation of files with the ".pub" extension in suspicious or uncommon locations. This could be a sign of attackers abusing Publisher documents

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\users\\public\\')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\temp\\'))) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.pub')))

output.summary: Detects creation of files with the ".pub" extension in suspicious or uncommon locations. This could be a sign of attackers abusing Publisher documents

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of ".pub" files from those locations Reference: https://twitter.com/EmericNasi/status/1623224526220804098
